Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; part of lotus flower and rosette in added white outline with added red centre; exterior: at rim, 'Z' frieze between bands; below, trace of pendant roundel and elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 79, NAU21), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in Chios. The sample number is written in ink 'NAU 21' on the break. For parallels regarding the exterior decoration, see British Museum 1924,1201.555 which Lemos places in the Wild Goat Style. However, the interior decoration on that sherd is inconsistent with the Wild Goat Style, which usually has some concentric bands. See also British Museum 1924,1201.329 which she places in the Chalice Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 264, pl. 72, no. 568)
Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-9, p. 82-3, fig. 2) (Nau 21)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0617) (phase 2)
